intro: Amaracarpus rhombifolius, commonly known as the diamond-leaf amara, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rhomboid-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
